Curriculum vitae

Professional preparation

Postdoctoral researcher, Institute of Arctic and Alpine Research, 2015-present   
University of Colorado, Boulder

Postdoctoral researcher, Department of Environmental Science, Policy and Management, 2015
University of California, Berkeley

Education

University of California, Berkeley, PhD in Ecosystem Science, 2015   
University of Western Australia, MSc in Natural Resources, 2010             
Yale University, BS Distinction in Biology, 2008

Software

    codyn: Community Dynamics Analysis. An R package for analysis of long-term ecological data.
    Lead developer, published on CRAN, latest version and issue-tracking on GitHub

Invited presentations

  • Spatial refugia, invasion, and climate change: Species conservation in the Anthropocene. 2015. Organized session speaker, Ecological Society of America, Baltimore, MD
  • Compensatory dynamics in nature: A stabilizing role for interspecific competition. 2015. Organized Ignite session speaker, Ecological Society of America, Baltimore, MD
  • Climate change structures a cyclical invasion into a rare serpentine grassland. 2014. Graduate Workshop on Environmental Data Analytics, National Center for Atmospheric Research, Boulder, CO
  •  Biotic mechanisms of community stability depend on the environmental context. 2013. University of Western Australia Ecology Seminar Series, Perth, Australia
  • The future of restoration ecology. 2013. Plenary Panelist, Society for Ecological Restoration, Madison, WI
  • How common is the historical reference ecosystem? A review of community-based restoration projects. 2013. Symposium speaker, Society for Ecological Restoration, Madison, WI
  • Maximizing the value of ecological restoration: Setting goals that are both desirable and resilient. 2013. Symposium speaker, Society for Ecological Restoration, Madison, WI
  • Are historical and novel ecosystems functionally equivalent? A test in California grasslands. 2012. Invited poster, Ecological Society of America Emerging Issues conference, National Conservation Training Center, WV
  • Novelty value: Intervention ecology and making the most of novel ecosystems. 2011. Symposium speaker, Society for Ecological Restoration, Merida, Mexico
  • Toward a conceptual framework for managing novel ecosystems. 2011. Restoration Institute, University of Victoria, Victoria, Canada
